name: df-isom
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4
body: |- wb(wiso(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4), wa(wf1o(c0, c3, c4), wral(s0, c3, wral(s1, c3, wb(wbr(cv(s0), c1, cv(s1)), wbr(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), c2, cfv(c0, cv(s1))))))))
comment: Define the isomorphism predicate. We read this as " ` H ` is an ` R ` , ` S ` isomorphism of ` A ` onto ` B ` ". Normally, ` R ` and ` S ` are ordering relations on ` A ` and ` B ` respectively. Definition 6.28 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 32, whose notation is the same as ours except that ` R ` and ` S ` are subscripts. (Contributed by NM, 4-Mar-1997.)
